“I don’t know…. I know nothing about it,” Sonia whispered. 

“No, you know nothing?” Luzhin repeated, his voice severe. 

“Think a moment, mademoiselle,” he continued, pausing. “Reflect.” 

“I’m prepared to give you time for consideration.” 

He took a breath. “I accuse you directly. I wouldn’t if I weren’t sure.” 

He glanced at Lebeziatnikov. “This morning, I changed securities for three thousand roubles.” 

He counted the money. “Two thousand three hundred roubles went into my pocket-book. Five hundred remained on the table.” 

“Then you entered, looking embarrassed. You jumped up three times to leave.” 

“I invited you to discuss Katerina Ivanovna’s hopeless position.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Luzhin accuses Sonia of theft, asserting that her embarrassment during their conversation indicates guilt.
